website_summaries.verdict: Honeywell's gadget is an impressive piece of smart-home tech, but its price feels a little too high for most consumers. And the fact it isn't waterproof is a major problem.
pros: The Honeywell Lyric Leak and Freeze Detector has one of the most feature-rich builds of any flood sensor on the market
cons: The high price seems inappropriate for a device that isn't waterproof and integrates with hardly any other gadget

customer_reviews.title: I only hope nothing happens while the servers are down.
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward installation. Perfect if you’re not text savvy. The app is OK. It will monitor temperature and humidity. I found it not being able to connect to the server. I don’t know why needs to connect to a server before I can see my devices on my own network. For this I gave it three stars. I only hope nothing happens while the servers are down.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but drop offline within a week
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these. The install process and app were fine. But 3 of the 4 dropped offline within a week of initial install. The detectors are installed in places where I have 4 wifi bars on my phone. They're in 3 different house location in 2 different houses. They're expensive if all they are is an audible alarm for water. Without the wifi part they're useless and overpriced. I tried resetting/re-setting them up to no avail. Now waiting on customer support to respond. Unfortunatley I no longer have the boxes or i'd just return them and move on. I would not recommend these at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Lost connections nightmare
customer_reviews.text: My Wi-Fi is pretty strong. I've a repeater and can use my cell phones, and laptop with Wi-FI everywhere in the house, and basement without issue. It does slow down a bit in the garage at the far end of the house. Even with fresh batteries these things basically constantly lose connection, and after the first week of getting nearly constant notifications of lost connections I basically ignore these bought cheapo audio alert ones and placed an Arlo camera in the basement to visually check. I would not trust these to be online in the event of a water issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but a pain to maintain
customer_reviews.text: Unit works as advertised - BUT - it's a pain to setup as mine kept rejecting my wi-fi router. I have two detectors and one quit working - lost connection to the wi-fi signal. After an hour of trying to 'reset' the device and connect to the house wi-fi, I found I had to set it up as being in a different 'home' to get it to connect to my wi-fi router. I hope I discover something better out there for the future, as this detector is too much trouble to keep going.
customer_reviews.author: Redsvbob

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: It worked so well until it bumped off-line while I was in Mexico. I got someone to go try to reset it and they finally figured out how to but it had to be synced to their phone. Far as I could tell we couldn’t sync it back to my phone because I wasn’t there. I had read about people putting a timer on their modem router so it would cycle off and on periodically but I’m not sure if that would have worked for me. I’m going to try it again so if it improves I’ll update.
customer_reviews.author: Isthata

customer_reviews.title: Received dead on arrival - device is locked out
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item from Amazon and received an item that was previously registered and marked as possibly stolen so the manufacturer locked out the device. After over 2 hours on hold, talking and emailing the manufacturer I've concluded I'm out my hard earned money. Needless to say it does not work DOA and I can't get assistance from Amazon because it was a few weeks past my return window.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: 5 minute installation process. Successfully tested with water.
customer_reviews.text: Downloaded the Honeywell Home app, powered up the unit, paired with Bluetooth and connected to my home WiFi in all of 5 minutes. Simple, no problems. Tested the unit by putting it into a dish and adding some water and it sounded its alarm (loudly) and sent my phone a notification within 10 seconds. Seems to work just fine. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Definately not doing the job
customer_reviews.text: This product just doesn't work for us. It goes offline every few weeks for a few days or a week at a time. We need a product that is reliable. It comes back online and we have a very stable internet connection so we know that is not the problem. And trying to get help is impossible. We like the Honeywell internet thermostat but not this product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: unreliable when additional alarms/sensors are added
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was impressed with this product. However, when I purchased a few additional alarms, the app became sluggish and one of the alarms starting alarming for water on occassion when no water was present. Eventually the app stopped working and after reinstalling it on my phone it's essentially nonfunctional. Needless to say I am not impressed with this product and I hope to return all of the alarms to honeywell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lifesaver with our sump pump in the basement and the super wet “mud season” months in northern Vermont. We have it set to a certain spot to alert us if the pump is suddenly not working and the water is approaching overflow. Phone notifications while not at home is extremely helpful for peace of mind. The one gripe is there sometimes is a delay in the notification from when the alarm sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: Had leak in basement on indoor/outdoor carpet, but unit failed to notify us. The water sensors on bottom of unit were slightly elevated off the floor, enough so that it didn't react to the damp carpet. Placed two squares of paper towel under each unit, notified me within 1 minute after absorbing water in carpet. Otherwise, I have 4 units that all work great in terms of humidity and temperature, notifying me every time exceeds ranges set. Software is easy to use. Aside from not immediately notifying me about carpet moister, which is now resolved, would have been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Ruder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try one of these when I installed a new wall oven that has a steam function. The water supply runs in behind my kitchen cabinets where it would be very difficult to detect a leak. The ability to add sensor cables allowed me to run the full 14' distance beside the water line and position the battery operated microprocessor where it would be convenient to replace batteries. I get notices via the internet on battery condition, temperatures and humidity. These are extremely easy to set up and I decided to purchase additional unit for my water heater and fridge/freezer. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.  Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and really works great.  Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, placed one in my basement to sense any water coming from our sump pit in the event our pump konks out and I’m not home. Second was placed behind the washing machine to detect any water leaks from those connections. So far so good. I really like the fact they measure humidity and room temperatures too, and I can set temperature and humidity levels and get emails and text messages if they drop below or go above those set numbers. Easy to do and the app is on my iPhone. Battery life is very good too.
customer_reviews.author: EKS

customer_reviews.title: Leak detector not designed to get wet.
customer_reviews.text: Leak detector flooded in very minor wetness. Top of unit has a groove that channels water into the electronics like a rain gutter. Top should have been designed slightly differently, with overlapping area to shield electronics like an umbrella. Photo shows channel. Electronics are directly below. I never reached Tech support, after being on hold ten minutes, so gave it one star. Leak detector is easy to set up and operates very well until wet. For $64, Honeywell should do better.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Connection signal could be stronger
customer_reviews.text: These are great for what they do. The problems I have with them is that they will lose signal with the router frequently. Even after replacing the batteries they still have the same symptoms. That said I would still recommend as they are life savers, if connected, for leaks and freezing temps.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Work's great but wish light indicated they were on.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I've had these units for about a month. A couple of times they didn't answer the poll by Honeywell that they were offline, however, they were okay by the next day. I know it might reduce the battery life slightly, but I wish their light would flash occasionally all the time to indicate they were working correctly when you checked on them. Other than a daily poll by the app, you have no idea if they are actually working by looking at them. a flash of the light every 10 seconds would be comforting and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: N. Levi

customer_reviews.title: Great for attic tankless water heater and AC drip pan
customer_reviews.text: I had a leak in my roof and an issue with my AC freezing. This units string I was able to tie around my roofs exhaust and also able to reach my drip pan all in 1 detector. The first setting up could be easier, but was finally able to get it only and check the status of the unit through my phone. I put in my cells email address, ex 123-456-7890@mms.att.net and now I get text alerts as well email alerts. This is worth the peace of mind of knowing your equipment is not leaking. Would buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother!
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a few weeks and then simply stopped connecting. Would not re-connect despite several efforts over several weeks. Our router is fine, the batteries new. Honeywell customer service has still not gotten back to me after contacting them by way of the website two weeks ago and also emailing them several times afterward. Spend the money on those simple alarms instead, or try a different brand. UPDATE, 1/10/19: Got it connecting again, finally. We'll see how long it functions this time. And I never did get a reply from Honeywell Customer Service, so I'm still not buying any more of this type of product from them.
customer_reviews.author: bd1954

customer_reviews.title: Great leak detector, expensive but can save $$$ in the long run
customer_reviews.text: I like that the wire is the part that actually can detect the leak. Wifi is a big plus. Only thing Honeywell needs to do is get with the Works for Google Assistant and potentially allow it to alert you thru google speakers when a leak is detected. This unit is expensive especially knowing you should probably have a few of them in a house but it can save you a lot of $$$, time and stress compared to a leaky faucet that goes unnoticed or water heater that leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Van Boven

customer_reviews.title: Keeps going offline - not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good hygrometer PROS: 1. Connects directly to WiFi 2. Has flood sensor (which I did not test) CONS: 1. I had similar issue as others have described with unit going offline periodically 2. Only measures and reports humidity up to 3 times per day. The Sensor Push hygrometer in contrast measures every minute or two. 3. Calibration only by 1% at time. Sensor Push hygrometer in contrast allows calibration by tenth of 1% 4. Inconsistent alarming when humidity goes above predetermined level
customer_reviews.author: Kostas

customer_reviews.title: Great product, except...
customer_reviews.text: Love the leak detectors, they work very well and are mostly bulletproof. However, this one was clearly a returned item. I went to add it to my system, and it had already been registered to another user. Had to contact Honeywell Customer Service, then wait 3 days for prior owner to respond that they no longer owned unit, before I could use the device. Extremely frustrating and annoying. Amazon should have a better way of vetting their returned products like this...
customer_reviews.author: robk72

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to WIFI
customer_reviews.text: Worked for two days and then wouldn't connect up again. Spent 2 hours with tech support and they gave up and said that my service provider would have to reconfigure my internet router to work with it. Basically it is more trouble than it is worth. I don't thinks my service provider will reconfigure my router without charging me if they can do it at all. Don't buy unless you want a lot of headaches and want to spend a lot of time on the phone unsuccessfully trying to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: DJSW

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing - bought 2 and both were junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and neither did absolutely anything in terms of leak detection. After it said the setup was completed successfully, I tried getting both the bottom and the probe wet and neither of them would alarm on either unit. I couldn’t believe how much junk these are.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Won’t connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Have used this fine at church, but two units would not connect to my Netgear WiFi at home. Even with open network (no security) settings, would not connect. All other devices in home connect no problem. Troubleshooting instructions way too geeky. Product description didn’t mention limited connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind leak detection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these and placed them around two water heaters and a well pump holding tank. So far, the only time any of them have alarmed is when my A/C failed last summer and condensation formed on the outside of the holding tank, dripped down and set off the alarm. This demonstrated how sensitive they are. I rely on them for early notification of leaks both when home and away.
customer_reviews.author: TennisBum

customer_reviews.title: Why 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: Why would these sensors only send updates 3 times a day. We live in a fast paced technology driven society that demands instant access. Real time monitoring would be so much more ideal. They say it's to conserve battery. Make a bigger battery compartment or make it lithium battery compatible. Such a good product that just needs real time monitoring. I will say that the sensors are accurate when they do send data.
customer_reviews.author: David Laws

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is my sixth water sensor leak detector of this same make and model. Each on has worked consistently well with no issues in connection. One did alert me to a water leak about a year ago saving significant damage. I can get their status on my Iphone with or without my home wi-fi so they have been good to know are operating when we travel.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: not made well
customer_reviews.text: Going on my fourth purchase. all had to be returned due to being defective. talked to tech and went through the set up and every time they said the system was bad, so enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these devices and after less than one year they were no longer able to connect to my home wifi. After speaking to customer support for about 30 minutes the rep said the device’s computer chip had failed and that no refund or exchange was possible. Honeywell has apparently spun off this product and associated technical support to a third party; so, if something goes wrong you are no longer dealing with Honeywell and are out of luck. What a piece of garbage!!
customer_reviews.author: Isabella K.

customer_reviews.title: Saved Me Already
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 3 months ago. I am far from a "technogeek" and I was able to set it up with my WiFi and test it in minutes. It is located in my kitchen with my router a few rooms away. It has never lost signal and works well. It has already caught a leak before it became a problem. It is a bit expensive but well worth it if catches even one leak. I intend to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Trying to Help

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to get an email if my house ever had a leak while I was away. I went on a trip and tried to check it and instead got a message that said, "Critical Alert - The date and time of your mobile device is incorrect...." I sent an email to "Honeywell" and got a ridiculous response that said it was normal and to uninstall the app, reboot, etc. reset while I was away on a trip. Very disappointed; Honeywell is not the old Honeywell that I grew up with.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Rope sensor for protecting a large area is smart
customer_reviews.text: Had it several months and works well. Set up easy for my WiFi. I installed the box upstairs with the rope sensor in the basement. You can do this with a 1/8 inch stereo phono extension cable. I also added extra rope sensors to completely surround my HVAC equipment. I really like the rope sensor for protecting a large area. The photos show my basement installation. There are two sensors. One is a previous Honeywell detector that did not have WiFi capability. Both work well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Strasser

customer_reviews.title: this thing should be great, but I've had nothing but problems with it
customer_reviews.text: In theory, this thing should be great, but I've had nothing but problems with it. Getting it onto my wireless network took quite a while, and once I did, it would not connect reliably to my wireless network (all Linksys gear, located on a shelf about 6 feet above the detector.) It actually seemed to cause other devices I had on my network to have trouble connecting, and once I pulled the batteries out, my other devices started behaving again. Ultimately, I just gave up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Keeps disconnecting from Internet
customer_reviews.text: The device was easy to set up but keeps going offline several times a week. Worked OK when I first installed it but now it will not hold my wi-fi signal even though it's connected to a 2.4 GHz network provided by Comcast. Honeywell is not much help. Called them twice. They suspect my internet but it works fine with all my other devices. I think that it is an old technology piece of equipment and I would not buy it if I had to do all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Ficks

customer_reviews.title: No issues setting this up, testing it
customer_reviews.text: I guess they've worked out the bugs because this was about as simple to setup as you could hope for. I also tested it just by wetting a paper towel then giving it a squeeze around the wire and it worked perfectly. Don't be afraid of this detector, seems to be working fine now and the app integration is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell technical support non existent
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I haven’t had a water issue to test functionality, however the device recently went offline and reconnecting with online tutorials unsuccessful. Three times I called technical support, each time on hold for an hour before giving up. Last time I took advantage of “not losing my place in the queue and receiving a callback”. It’s been 30 hours with no call.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up & multiple alert options.
customer_reviews.text: Device set-up went very well. I like that I has a pretty loud alert, in addition to Honeywell Home App notifications and emails. This is an in-home install, so the notifications and emails are a nice to have. I like that the Moisture Sensor contacts are on the silicon encased bottom of the device or you can use the provided 6’ Sensor Cable (feels like a braided cord). An extra cord can be purchased to extend the total corded sensor area. Establishing a Honeywell Home account took a bit longer due to latency in getting the Confirmation Email (first attempts took a couple hours).
customer_reviews.author: Tim Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Would not connect to WI-FI
customer_reviews.text: This detector would not connect to WI-FI no matter what I tried. I think it was a result of a bad product because I do have another one which I bought and it operates as advertised and monitors and detects water leaks, and report temperature and humidity as advertised. But, this last one was definitely defective and I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Artis Walker

customer_reviews.title: excellent item - works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to monitor a crawl space and it works terrific! Easy to install, I did have to buy an extension for the cord so I could see the detector light in our room and the detection portion of the cord would be in the crawlspace - but the wifi notification is so awesome! I feel like I will know as soon as there is a problem!
customer_reviews.author: happy gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised or better:) I have 5 now. 4 of them in use for about 2+years...and they have already alarmed/warned me of at about 4 water leaks. 2 of these leaks were rapid and large and would have done serious/expensive damage to laminate wood floors from kitchen sink...and laundry room hose problem. Additionally, the high humidity alerts (from smaller intermittent leaks, or a wild mopping/floor cleaning job, etc) work well too. Link to phone app and internet/email warns me where/when ever I am away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Smith

customer_reviews.title: You had one job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for what I hoped would be an early warning against a possible ejector pump failure, which causes water to come up this drain in our basement. Came downstairs to find the "sensor" rope fully submerged. Prior to installing, had tested the unit to ensure it would alert on a leak. Also received humidity alerts from it in the past, so I know it operated. Just not when it actually needed to. Unit is less than a month old. Avoid if you actually need to know when there's a leak.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Falconer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless piece of junk - customer service even worse.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this leak and freeze detector on the basis that it would connect to wi-fi and alert me of any, well, freezes or leaks. The detector would not connect to wi-fi. I confirmed that all settings on both this detector and my wi-fi would work together. I spent an hour on hold with Honeywell customer service. I also tried using their online chat (that never worked). I spoke with a representative for about 4 minutes and she told me she would email me directions that I could send to my internet company. She never sent that email and I'm returning this item. Total junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It wouldn't connect to my iPhone 10
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't complete the set up as it wouldn't connect to my iPhone 10. I tried numerous ways. Restarted my iPhone. Went on their support site and followed those directions. The best Honeywell came up with was try another phone. At that point, I returned the item and got a refund. It just shouldn't be this hard.
customer_reviews.author: Knipfty

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and it works....so far
customer_reviews.text: Just got one...very easy to install! I tested it yesterday and today, works fine. The water leak detector would mail me a leak warnings, by email AND by message It only send the warning to one email address,( others devices send it to more) which is a problem since I would like the super in our building get the message as well.
customer_reviews.author: patricia samwick

customer_reviews.title: Easy - Set and Forget until the sensor reports a problem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Honeywell WiFi Water Leak Detector to monitor the sump pump pit. Occasionally the pump's float switch wedges itself against the sides of the pit and does not activate the pump, allowing the basement to flood, I simply looped a coil of the sensor cable and dropped it down the pit a few inches to notify me before water escapes the pit. Easy WiFi setup through the app. Works great I am ordering a second for the other half of my duplex.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J Wittlieff

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to monitor temp and moisture in my Small Datacenter and in my office. Want to keep those water free and at a specific temp. Been running them for 4 days now or so and they seem to be working well. Haven't tested what they do if there is water yet. Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what its supposed to,  GREAT if you are away from home
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product! After a freeze and pipe burst in my house i bought this to alert me to temperature and moisture changes. It does exactly that through the honeywell app and it is fairly easy to set up and it works well. You can set up multiple alerts to multiple people. Its been 5 months and the batteries i installed are still at 90%. Really a great product.
customer_reviews.author: badlittledog

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Put in basement where water intrusion happens sometimes. Sure enough I left a sprinkler running and water got into the basement well and began easing down the concrete wall. The alarm went off, sent emails, and I couldn’t ask for better response to my situation
customer_reviews.author: Civdiv99

customer_reviews.title: Provides Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two units to place at our hot water heater and sump pump about two years ago. The unit at the hot water heater was tripped by water leaking from another source (central air water condensation issue) a couple of months after it was installed. It was comforting to see that the alarm work as designed. We periodically get high and low humidity warnings from the alarms due to their location in the basement. We haven’t adjusted the threshold for those levels as it’s an opportunity to confirm the units are still communicating properly with our Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should own these!
customer_reviews.text: Installed thes after we had a water issue. Less than a week after we installed them we were alerted in the middle of the night about the leak. We were able to turn the water off and fix the leak with ZERO damage. Everyone should own these!
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: SW is not awesome
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, the detector is awesome. It's the software that is meh... You can't set notifications for 100% humidity, or an actual leak. And all you can get is an email. Now if I have a leak, an actual leak, with standing water on the ground, I want an (at least an option for) alarm. Something that really gets my attention. An email? Hours could go by before I see an email.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect too much life from this product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and was hoping to get a few years of uninterrupted use from it. In fact, the instructions say the AA batteries should last 3 years. Funny! My leak detector stopped working after a few months. I've changes batteries and tried to reset, but the thing doesn't respond. Honeywell Tech Support helpful you say? Forget that. You'll wait on hold for an hour and if you're lucky, the system won't disconnect you. Overall, this has been a horrible purchase and I would not recommend. One more piece of crap product brought in from China.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Tietsworth

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Not only did the app not work - It would not verify via e-mail so I could use the app on my ipad and had to use my phone - the water sensor senses water when it is sitting on the table next to me with no water. The app on my phone has no home screen - no ability to see the two sensors it thinks it is connected to (when I tried to reconnect my sensor), no temperature or humidity values. When I look at the instructions for this model online, it tells me to connect to the Honeywell Lyric app which does not exist. I had such high hopes for the Honeywell name....
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Looks kind of 'old' but functions perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any leaks, but this was easy to install and I like that it tracks the temp and humidity in the laundry room. I will get another one for under the kitchen sink. Already had a Lyric thermostat so it's easy to manage using the same app. It's quality, even though the plastic is a bit gray ala early 2000's home desktop PC cases. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bypod

customer_reviews.title: how to get replacement under warranty
customer_reviews.text: product has 2 year warranty. Product quit working about 2 days age. Called water leak detector support line (1-800-633-3991) . Support person ran product through a series of tests and said product was defective and had 2 year warranty to be handled by location I purchased from. Puled up order in Amazon and under support was listed number (1-877-841-2840). Called number and was told it was for Honeywell and product was now sold by Resideo and gave me number I had for support (1-800-633-3991). Feel like I am running in a circle - how do I get a replacement water leak detector under warranty ?
customer_reviews.author: john kearney

customer_reviews.title: Works well.  Setup easy with some phones and tablets.
customer_reviews.text: The Lyric works as advertised. Had to use an old phone to set up the wireless connection because it didn't work with my Nexus 6P. Honeywell's tech support was good but it should not be necessary to call them. Honeywell knows about the unit's inability connect to some phones but I did not find any info in their literature or FAQ.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy Bubba

customer_reviews.title: No problem at all with WiFi connection and Honeywell Home App
customer_reviews.text: Read a few reviews that stated app wasn't available or outdated. Instructions in box were clearly stated as to which app to download. Instant app recognition of device and easy / intuitive user setup and interface. All functions of device are working and reporting via app as specd. Extension sensor IS included in OEM box BTW
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, alerts work!
customer_reviews.text: I've installed these units for others and finally bought one for myself. The temp, humidity, and leak sensing works exactly as expected. I appreciate the cable extension for leak detection, as it can easily be laid out near my sump pump and water heater. Alarm is loud when a leak is in progress. Nice unit!
customer_reviews.author: Nick W.

customer_reviews.title: Functioning as designed
customer_reviews.text: This product is working as expected. Like the fact it is working and able to be monitored with my Lyric thermostat using the same Honeywell app on my iPhone. The only drawback I see is that warnings appear to be delivered via email only and not using a text message.
customer_reviews.author: GCF

customer_reviews.title: It works and is reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Though it took several tries to get it to connect to the wifi, after it was connected it seems to work well. It has not experienced any alarm conditions yet, so the alarm has not been tested, but I have been checking each day and it shows the temp and humidity and graphs them as well. Battery powered is a plus so you don't need an outlet. Price is reasonable for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Martin

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The only reasonable product that'll give remote readout of temperature, humidity, and water warning all in one unit that I've found. Only reason I took a star off is because you can only set the readings to once, twice or three times a day. It's not something that you log in and get an instant current readings. But I guess they had to set it this way to prolong the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: Has problems
customer_reviews.text: Once a month the product drops its Wi-Fi connection and getting it to reconnect takes many tries. Most recently it wont complete the configuration process at all. Seems to be a bug in their configuration procedure as the Wi-Fi signal is fine.
customer_reviews.author: B. R

customer_reviews.title: Refused to connect to internet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for a vacation cabin as a freeze alert after paying to have internet service installed just for the purpose of allowing remote monitoring. Internet works fine, this product was started just fine but then repeatedly was not able to connect to internet. I left it for a tech-savvy friend to work on, but they had the same issue. By the time I could return to the cabin, the window for returning it had closed. Waste of money, not only for the freeze detector, but also for the expenses of internet installation.
customer_reviews.author: Amy R.

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: After working ok for several weeks, the device is now frequently going offline. After a while (48hrs to 72hrs) it comes back. And, if it doesn't then I have to go to the basement and pull the batteries out and put back in. Batteries are always ok. In the meantime, there is no detection. I will look for another alternative and dispose of the Honeywell.
customer_reviews.author: MAS

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable; sips power
customer_reviews.text: I now have 5 of these in three houses. I've had two minor incidents in two years, both of which I've been able to get to before any significant damage was done. My oldest unit is at 42% battery after two years. The android app is reasonably easy to set up, and is very reliable. Honeywell stuff just works.
customer_reviews.author: Gary in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Would not connect to wifi
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this leak detector. However, like a lot of reviewers, it would not connect to my home wifi so it will not work for me and I'm returning it. I bought 2 and neither would connect after multiple attempts with each. My wifi broadcasts in both 5GHz and 2.4GHz. Spent over an hour on this and wish I had the time back.
customer_reviews.author: WMcK

customer_reviews.title: A couple issues....
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work after a couple issues. It would not set up via email and link. The Honeywell help link was under maintenance. I called and the rep reset it, and we got up and running. The irritating part, this shipped from Amazon with dead Duracell batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Joel's Antiques

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised once connected to WIFI. Detected a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised once connected to WIFI. Detected a leak promptly from leaky Insinkerator. Got very lucky on that one. Don't use iPhone 7 to program as known Bluetooth issues will not able to keep the device connected to finish programming. Use iPhone 6 or older model instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jorence Zhen

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Reports dampness anywhere on cable or unit. Much better than the D-Link model, which only reports water when it is deep enough to submerge the cable end (and which does not report temperature or humidity). Only disappointment is that you cannot request temperature data from it - it reports it automatically either once, twice or three times a day (user setting).
customer_reviews.author: Roquie

customer_reviews.title: Falls offline
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great, but the performance is short lived. This item falls offline and loses it's WiFi connection.
customer_reviews.author: joe barela

customer_reviews.title: Saved water buildup at work
customer_reviews.text: Used the Honeywell app on my smart phone Now it alerts me at home when there is water coming in through a crack in the AC ducts into the furnace area. Alert reports it is resolved after my system pumps the water out. Some rust on the tip, but still working. Might need a new sting at some point but that is ok, this device has saved my ducts filling with water
customer_reviews.author: ESP

customer_reviews.title: Great product & app
customer_reviews.text: I have three in our condo for the many months we are often gone and they work very well. I can track temperature and humidity throughout the condo and, if there is any water leak, I get an alarm. Have had them for over a year and they work fine; change batteries every 6 or 12 months. No problems with the units or the app.
customer_reviews.author: History Man

customer_reviews.title: Great peace of mind around hot water tank
customer_reviews.text: this leak detector gives me great peace of mind in my water heater closet. I have half the cord inside the pan and the other half outside the pan so no matter where the water leak is, this detector will know about it and text me and two friends that I have a problem and need immediate attention.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne T.

customer_reviews.title: Ok but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This detector works as advertised but could be better. When alarm goes off the only way to mute the alarm is to login into it's Honeywell online account and mute. Nothing physically is available on the device itself. Poor engineering.
customer_reviews.author: BobM

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product for my basement giving me peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product for my basement giving me peace of mind around my boiler area, especially in that I shut the house water at that location while away. Like it enough that I may buy a few more for other basement spots tending the house while away during only single days and leaving the water on. Oh - I made sure to test it several times.
customer_reviews.author: NJP

customer_reviews.title: Could not shut off alarm!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Tested, and yes it works. However, I could not silence the alarm once out of the test. Kept on sending message on my cell phone. Took batteries out.. now collecting dust. Too bad, unit looks well made. Disappointed with manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: JCD

customer_reviews.title: Best wifi water leak detector on the market
customer_reviews.text: The Honeywell leak detector is super cool, one of the best products on the market of it's kind. I am slightly disappointed that the most frequently you can schedule the updates is three times a day: seems like a lot of water damage could occur in 8 hours. But setup could not have been easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as promised!
customer_reviews.text: It would be a terrific product if it just sent out notifications as promised. Honeywell should be ashamed, selling a product that they know doesn't work. You have to go onto the app to see the humidity level. It does not send out notifications by text or email when the humidity exceeds the limits you set. We thought we had it set up incorrectly, and finally called Honeywell. We were told it just doesn't work, they know it, they have been selling it regardless, and may have a fix in mid December. Talk about false advertising!
customer_reviews.author: BevieG

customer_reviews.title: Faulty unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to be alerted of a water leak, from the hot water tank, wherever I am, whether inside the house or away from the house. However, I am returning the unit. Set up was easy but as soon as I placed it on the basement floor the alarm immediately went off when there was no water leak. Worse, even after muting the alarm, deleting the alarm, resetting the unit and removing the batteries the loud piercing alarm would not stop. I called Honeywell and they said it must be a faulty unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Generic Packaging, Beware
customer_reviews.text: Product came in a generic white box with NO instruction manual or any documentation of any kind. Just Lyric, 3 batteries, and extension cable. Based on packaging, I do not know if this is authentic or black market unit.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Works well, simple to set up
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up. Cord is appropriately sensitive to water. Battery life seems to be only a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Kingston Special

customer_reviews.title: Very useful to have
customer_reviews.text: This water leak sensor is very good. I use it for the sump pump, just in case it fails. The wifi functionality sends a notification to my phone which is very useful in case of an emergency. There is also an audible alarm that sounds. This product came with an extension cord, that connects to the detector, to get a better water reading. The only downside, is that it takes a minute to detect water or to send commands to the detector, like to silence the alarm. However, you can also just disconnect, then reconnect the batteries to silence the alarm as well.
customer_reviews.author: John Papetti III

customer_reviews.title: The Lyric is solid and WORKS !!
customer_reviews.text: I had one Lyric and have purchased three more. The one I had alerted me at 4:00 in the morning to a water leak in my basement. I was able to get the water up and move personal items before any major damage. The backing is rubber and makes a nice seal. Setup is very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Duke's Mom

customer_reviews.title: save us 2 times after install in our new cabinets ...
customer_reviews.text: save us 2 times after install in our new cabinets. Alerted me on my phone when we went to the store and found my sink leaking from underneath .only complaint is batteries run out fast and should have some type of power supply but then again we ae dealing with water so I understand why
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This
customer_reviews.text: Goes off line too frequently. Basically useless. Was off line during a freeze warning but let me know five hours later.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Two Units and Ten Hours to No Avail
customer_reviews.text: I have spent at least ten hours and tried two different units but have experienced nothing but frustration trying to connect to our network (that hosts numerous other smart-home devices) after troubleshooting by phone and Honeywell's tech Twitter team. I do commend their responsiveness online but can't justify the amount of time I have lost. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: The device itself is good, but there is no light that lets you ...
customer_reviews.text: Its ok... If It saves me from a huge water issue, I may change my tune a bit. The device itself is good, but there is no light that lets you know its connected and working. The app is to be desired, it honestly needs a lot of work... But i didn't buy it for the app, I bought it to protect my house from water damage.
customer_reviews.author: nbiron

customer_reviews.title: Water Sensor
customer_reviews.text: Placed it in the same room as water heater and washer. It detected water from the condensation coming from the heating pipe. This gadget works. Does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Schmura

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I tried twice to connect this device to my home wifi network. The first itme, I was on the phone with technical support for 1 hour. We even tried connecting it to my iPhone hotspot to see if the problem was my home network. Still wouldn't connect. The technical support person told me the product must be defective. I returned it and decided to replace it with a new one and give it another try. Same result - NO CONNECTION!. I'm switching to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: LC SLC

customer_reviews.title: ... line attached ran under dishwasher - WiFi app is easy to install - easy to monitor temperature and humidity ...
customer_reviews.text: Ran under kitchen sink water supplies and drain then with extender line attached ran under dishwasher - WiFi app is easy to install - easy to monitor temperature and humidity via app - no leaks so far but the unit is suppose to notify any number of phones you designate in that event
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Arrived and as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the USPS as they tracked this package down sitting in the back of a postal hub. The item is what I ordered and works! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Maleko

customer_reviews.title: Early warning system
customer_reviews.text: My A/C air handling unit is in the attic, and occasionally had condensation overflow issues. This detector warns me before the water starts leaking into the bedroom. Coupled with my net-enabled Honeywell thermostat, I can even shut the AC off remotely if there is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to follow the instructions carefully & install the app beforehand. I tested it by placing it in the fridge & wetting the cable. It detected both low temperature & leak. in each case the device beeped an alarm & sent an email notification as described. Others have said the email is unreliable so I check the app often, especially when away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: no bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Device requires to connect to bluetooth to configure, however was unable to connect to blue tooth on device. Device unusable as received. Tech support was no help- just instructions how to reset, after resetting still no connection.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great product if it did what it is advertised to ...
customer_reviews.text: Would be a great product if it did what it is advertised to do. The audible alarm works well when the sensing cable detects water however it took two days of trying to get it to connect to Wi-Fi. After finally getting it to pair with the Wi-Fi network ran another leak test. The audible alarm sounded but a notification was never sent to the app. Then hours later the app said the unit had disconnected from the Wi-Fi. Another day with tech support and they had no idea what could be causing the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Watson

customer_reviews.title: I own an HVAC company and we recommend this product to our customers but....
customer_reviews.text: This product does work well but it doesn't have the power of your cell phones Wi-Fi running on 3 AA batteries. I run an HVAC company and we recommend this product to our customers but if they have connection issues we simply recommend a wireless repeater. They sell one that will work for $50 or less. Most of our customers don't have connection issues with this device.
customer_reviews.author: G. McVay

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: After having my basement flood twice this has been a huge lifesaver. I no longer have to worry while I'm away from home that my basement is having issues again. I even get notifications when my dehumidifier isn't running enough. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: KRISTEN

customer_reviews.title: water leak detector
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. Not only does it detect a leak it will tell you the temp and humidity. If I did not have this I would have several leaks costing thousands. Best money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and monitoring via app
customer_reviews.text: We now have 5 of these in various places so we can detect any leaks as soon as possible. They are easy to set up and it’s nice to be able to check the status of each one at any time via the app. The batteries last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Karlene Seime

customer_reviews.title: Feel safe when away
customer_reviews.text: I got these to feel safe when I am not around my second home for extended period. TRhey work well. You HAVE to connect it to 2.5ghz WiFi which can be problematic for some. So if you have a 5ghz WiFi at your home you will need someone to help you if you don’t know how
customer_reviews.author: Dave J

product_meta.title: Honeywell Home RCHW3610WF1001/N Wi-Fi Water Leak Detector, White
product_meta.description: The Honeywell Home water leak and freeze detector is an early warning system that notifies you on your smartphone when a leak is detected or the temperature drops bellows a temperature of your choice. By catching it early, you may be able to avoid expensive repairs and loss of treasured items.
feature_bullets: Wi-Fi water leak detector sends alerts by text and email. Also has an audible alarm. Geofencing technology can tell who's nearest, and sends an "all clear" when the problem has been resolved. Does not need a separate hub or base station. A 4 Ft. extension sensors (sold separately). Senses temperature and humidity. Monitoring home humidity levels can assist in alerting homeowner of potential mold formation in the home. Install water leak detection systems on major appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines or hot water heaters to monitor leaks. Detector is reusable. Cold-Alert detection. Easy to install.

specifications.Special Features: Alarm Sensor Type Floor, Number of Sensors Included 1, Indoor/Outdoor Indoor, Surveillance Features Audio Alert/Siren,WiFi Enabled, Battery Back-Up Yes, Sensor Type Water
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars532 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
